posts.title: 01 Singleton
posts.text: Singleton does…“Ensure a class having one instance only”“Provide a global access point of it” When to use Singleton?“There should be only one instance. And,”“The instance should be accessible at the well known location”Considerable usages of Singleton?“Shared resource accessing.” … Network printer queue.“Database accessing.”“Logging.” Pros“Good to control accesses to a single instance.”“Easy to switch the class which allows for a variable number of instances.”“More flexible than using static class methods, taking variable numbers of instances into account.”Cons“Not has better efficiency than using global variable.” ┕ “Considering the needs of accessing from anywhere,       using Singleton is in turn same as using global variable.” Code Samples“This is creaional pattern.”“Createional pattern defers object creation activity to another object.”“In Singleton, that is itself to have the duty  to create object through getInstance() method.”C++1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738// Singleton Class// Due to space issue, header implementation is usedclass dbObject {private: static dbObject* _dbInstance; // actual instance to be accessed dbObject(); // ctor blocked to control instantiation int userCount = 0; // example for singleton instance usagepublic: // User should use this member func to get an instance static dbObject* getDbInstance() { // if instance is null, call constructor, Or use existing instance _dbInstance == 0 ? _dbInstance = new dbObject() : _dbInstance; // just print out instance creation cout<< ++userCount << " user(s) accessed to the dbinstance!\n"; return _Instance; } };// Client class access to Singletonclass User {private: dbObject* _dbInstance;public: User() : // User creation calls Singleton method _dbInstance(dbObject::getDbInstance()) {} //...};// implementationint main() { User user1 = new User(); // 1 user(s) accessed to the dbinstance! User user2 = new User(); // 2 user(s) accessed to the dbinstance! User user3 = new User(); // 3 user(s) accessed to the dbinstance! // ... } C#123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536// Singleton Classpublic class Printer { private static Printer* _prtQueue; // actual instance to be accessed private Printer(); // ctor blocked to control instantiation private int queue = 0; // example for singleton instance usage // User should use this member func to get an instance public static Printer* getInstance() { // if instance is null, call constructor, Or use existing instance _prtQueue == 0 ? _prtQueue = new Printer() : _prtQueue; // just print out instance creation Console.WriteLine($"{queue} user(s) is in the printer queue!\n"); return _prtQueue; } };// Client class access to Singletonclass User { private Printer* _prtInstance; public User() { // User creation calls Singleton method _prtInstance = Printer.getInstance(); } //...};// implementationclass Program { static void main(string[] args) { User user1 = new User(); // 1 user(s) is in the printer queue! User user2 = new User(); // 2 user(s) is in the printer queue! User user3 = new User(); // 3 user(s) is in the printer queue! // ... }} Related Patterns“Abstract Factory”“Builder”“Prototype”Can be implemented in Singleton Pattern. Questions?Is this Singleton is naturally ‘Thread-Safe’? < Inspired by GOF >

posts.title: Multiple Inheritance
posts.text: Multiple Inheritance with C++, C#, or Java Overview Overview concepts C++ C# Java Class A blueprint for creating object. Includes state and behavior. Can be considered as a user-defined.Type. Abstract Class* A class includes at least one pure virtual function. A class with methods that has 'abstract' modifier which defers implementation to its children. Interface* Abstract class does a similar job. With 'interface' modifier, defines a set of behaviours. *Consider very basic concept only.*abstract class and interface cannot be instantiated. Multiple Inheritance  a class can derived from one or more parents Multiple Inheritance C++    C#    Java    Class / Virtual Class O    X    X    Abstract Class O    X    X    Interface* O    O    O    *In C++, pure abstract class does similar jobs for the interface.

posts.title: Vue.js Introduction
posts.text: Vue Directives & Component optionsVue Official WebComponent options Data data Type Object, accepts function, and returns an object with properties. props Type Array, accepts data from the parent component. Contains a set of attributes. methods (event handling) Type Object of Function. computed (computed properties) Type Object of Function (collections). watch Key name is the attribute/expression to watch and its value is the callback. Be careful with arrow functions for methods, computed and watch. DOM el Type CSS string or Html Element. Can mount on a DOM element when new is used for instance creation. ‘#’ prefix is used in value to get the id of an Element. template Type string. This is used as the markup(html) for the Component/instance. Template replace the mounted element. Directives v-if | v-else | v-else-if  Render element(s) by conditions initially contained in v-if, then additionally add paths with v-else or v-else-if v-show  Display element(s) by conditions. v-show keeps elements in DOM and display elements when its CSS changes. v-for  Has ability to display multiple elements with source data. Can use Array, Object, string etc. Need to specify an item in Array/Object with a index/key in a group to render. If reorder is required, put a key value in ‘:key’ value after v-for. v-on:  Has shorthand ‘@’. Work with Function or Object, to handle event(s). Has modifiers to use (@event .MODIFIER). v-bind  Has shorthand ‘:’. Work with Any (argument: attr or prop) or Object (no arg.), to handle dynamic binding of attr-expr or prop-expr. Class binding is to bind style, Prop binding is to bind with child prop which should be declread properly in the child component. Has modifiers to use (@event .MODIFIER). v-model  For input|select|textare elements or components. Generates two-way binding on them. Has modifiers to use (@event .MODIFIER).

posts.title: Number Cracker
posts.text: Link to the GameNumber Cracker Layout 1234567891011121314151617<template> <div> <h1>{{result}}</h1> <h2>Try to guess 4-digit unique number.</h2> <form v-on:submit.prevent="onSubmitForm"> <input ref="input" minlength="4" maxlength="4" v-model="value"/> <button type="submit">Try!</button> </form> <div>Trial: {{trials.length}}</div> <ul> <li v-for="trial in trials" :key="trial"> <div>{{trial.try}}</div> <div>{{trial.result}}</div> </li> </ul> </div></template> Vue things v-on:submit.prevent in form element to block refreshign the page. Then button ‘submit’ will do another thing. v-for will show list-items augmented as the user clicks the submit button. v-model will get a value from input box and send it to ‘value’ in data. How to play At start, 4-digit unique random number is selected. The number is ranged between 1 - 9. The user can guess 10 times. If a number is in the list but in another position, it’s counted as ball. If a number is in a right place, it’s counted as strike. If the user get the correct number within 10 tries, the user wins. Game algorithmThere is a helper function to initially pick 4 random unique numbers. There is an candidates array of 9 numbers (1 - 9). To implement random unique number, used Math.floor() and Math.random(). To make a chosen number unique, used candidates.splice(RANDOM_CHOSEN_NUMBER) Pick a number 4 times in a loop, in each loop push the random number to a new array. Main game algorithm is as follows. Has 4 data(or states) elements answer: get array of random number trials: an array of user trials value: get user’s trial numbers from input box reuslt: a string to display a title or game progress There is one method for the game lifecyle. First, compare input with the answer. array.join(‘’) is used to make the array into 4 digit number to match with input numbers. If the input is wrong, analyze the input numbers (compare with answer). Displays the result in the list. Repeat till get the answer or waste all 10 chances. Cracking Failed Cracking Succeed vue scripts1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162636465666768697071727374757677787980<script> const numGenerator = () => { const candidates = [1, ... , 9] const chosen = [] for (let i = 0; i < 4; i++) { const pick = candidates.splice( // random() returns [0 ... 1) // maximum 0.9x -> 0.9x * 9 (1st time) => 8.x // so floor is used to get correct number range. // floor(8.x, 1) is 9, so one from min 0, max 9 can be picked. Math.floor( Math.random() * (candidates.length) ), 1)[0] // splice returns an array of deleted number(s) chosen.push(pick) } } export default { data () { return { answer: getNumbers(), trials: [], state: '', value: '', result: 'Number Cracker' } }, methods: { onSubmitForm () { if (this.value === this.answer.join('')) { // if input matches the answer this.trials.push({ try: this.value, result: 'Home Run!' }) this.result = 'Home Run!' alert('Restarting the game.') this.answer = getNumbers() this.value = '' this.trials = [] this.$refs.input.focus() } else { if (this.trials.length <= 8) { let strike = 0 let ball = 0 const answerArray = this.value.split('').map((v) => parseInt(v)) for (let i = 0; i < 4; i++) { if (answerArray[i] === this.answer[i]) { // 숫자 자리수 모두 정답 strike++ } else if (this.answer.includes(answerArray[i])) { // 숫자만 정답 ball++ } } this.trials.push({ try: this.value, result: `${strike} strike, ${ball} ball!` }) this.value = '' this.$refs.input.focus() if (this.trials.length === 9) { this.result = 'This is the last chance!' this.state = 'last' } else { this.result = 'Guessing...' this.state = 'ongoing' } } else { this.result = `You already tried 10 times. The number was ${this.answer.join('')}.` alert('Restarting the game.') this.answer = getNumbers() this.value = '' this.trials = [] this.$refs.input.focus() } } } } } // export default</script> Inspired by ZeroCho. posts.title: Reaction Time Tester
posts.text: Link to the GameReaction Time Tester Layout 1234567891011<template> <div> <div id="box" :class="state" @mousedown="onClickBox">{{msg}}</div> <template v-show="results.length"> <!-- template inside the template can tie other elements (except the first parent div) together that need not parent div --> <div>Average Time: {{average}} ms</div> <button @click="onReset">Reset Time</button> </template> </div></template> Vue things <template>: Child Template can group other elements. v-show: Conditionally ‘displays’ the element by changes of its CSS. v-bind: Class binding for the app to change style (color). computed: Similar to method, but it only runs when injected element changes How to play Click the box to go ready - steady. Click ASAP again when the box is turned into green. Game algorithmThis is simple. The app has an array of times of the user’s reaction results And has a state to change colors bound to the div class. From color of ‘steady’ to color of ‘go’ in random time Through div_id.class selector, we can select colors conditionally. To get average time, Array.reduce() is used. Reset button resets the app to the initial state. Reaction Time Testing vue scripts123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960<script>let begin = 0;let end = 0;let timeout = null; export default { data() { return { results: [], state: 'ready', msg: 'Click to start', } }, computed: { average() { return ( this.result.reduce( (a, c) => a + c, 0 ) / this.result.length || 0 ); }, }, methods: { onReset() { this.results = []; }, onClickScreen() { if(this.state === 'ready') { // clicked initial screen to start this.state = 'steady'; this.message='Click with GREEN!'; timeout = setTimeout(() => { // with timeout, wait for green screen this.state = 'go'; this.message = 'CLICK NOW!!'; begin = new Date(); // set start time }, Math.floor(Math.random()* 1000) + 2000); // 2~3 sec } else if (this.state === 'steady') { // clicked when steady, too early this.state = 'ready'; this.message = 'Toooooo Early! Click with green.'; clearTimeout(timeout); } else if (this.state === 'go') { // reset to initial state end = new Date(); // set end time this.state = 'ready'; this.message='Click to start'; this.results.push(end - begin); // gets reaction time } }, },}</script><style scoped> /* `scoped` means this style is dedicated to this component only */ #screen { width: 400px; height: 300px; text-align: center; user-select: none; /* prevent user to select text */ } #screen.ready { background-color: red; } #screen.steady { background-color: orange; } #screen.go { background-color: green; }</style> Inspired by ZeroCho. posts.title: Tic-Tac-Toe
posts.text: Link to the GameTic-Tac-Toe Layout 1234567891011121314151617<template> <div> <div id="turns"> {{player}}'s turn. </div> <table id="t2"> <tr v-for="(rowD, rowI) in tableSet" :key="rowI + Math.random()"> <td id="td2" v-for="(cell_id, cell_Idx) in rowD" :key="cell_Idx + Math.random()" @click="onClickCell(rowI, cell_Idx)"> {{cell_id}} </td> </tr> </table> <div id="turns" v-if="winner"> {{winner}} wins! </div> <div id="turns" v-if="draw"> Draw </div> </div></template> Vue things vuex: has 4 props; [state, mutations, getters, actions] state: similar to vue’s data object mutations: mutates states synchronously, similar to events actions: triggers mutations asynchronously with commit() getters: similar to computed prop for vuex stroes. vuex store: Plays a role of centralized shared storage for all Vue components. mapState: a helper to connect computed prop to multiple states, and make it easier to load states with shorter codes. Other vuex props have their own helpers. this.$store.commit: actually changes states by committing mutations. <slot />: Make children compontnents overridable and expandable in their parents. Deprecated in vue3 with new v-slot. How to play There are 9 cells in a table. Make a line of your symbols in any row, in any column, or in one of both diagonals. Game algorithmIt’s Tic-Tac-Toe! Mainly focused on how parent-children components handle data/state. But Vuex can handle those roles instead. Components has no need to communicate themselves through emit events. Tic-Tac-Toe Testing vue scripts1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162636465666768697071<script>// connects to vuex statesimport { mapState } from 'vuex'; // loading mutations from vueximport { CLICK_CELL, SET_WINNER, RESET_GAME, CHANGE_TURN, NO_WINNER } from './store'//export default { components: { }, computed: { ...mapState( ['winner', 'turn', 'player', 'draw', 'tableSet'], ), // default }, methods: { onClickCell(rowI, cellIdx) { // prevent duplicate cell clicks if(this.tableSet[rowI][cellIdx]) { return; } // this.$store.commit( CLICK_CELL, { rowInfo: rowI, cellInfo: cellIdx } ); // let win = false; // Check winning conditions // any row of same 3 symbols if(this.tableSet[rowI][0] === this.turn && this.tableSet[rowI][1] === this.turn && this.tableSet[rowI][2] === this.turn ) { win = true; } // any column of same 3 symbols if(this.tableSet[0][cellIdx] === this.turn && this.tableSet[1][cellIdx] === this.turn && this.tableSet[2][cellIdx] === this.turn ) { win = true; } // diagonal to the left if(this.tableSet[0][0] === this.turn && this.tableSet[1][1] === this.turn && this.tableSet[2][2] === this.turn ) { win = true; } // diagonal to the right if(this.tableSet[0][2] === this.turn && this.tableSet[1][1] === this.turn && this.tableSet[2][0] === this.turn ) { win = true; } // win? Draw? Or keep Playing if (win) { // win this.$store.commit(SET_WINNER, this.turn); this.$store.commit(RESET_GAME); } else { // keep checking let allMarked = true; // check full table this.tableSet.forEach((rowInfo) => { rowInfo.forEach((cellInfo) => { if(!cellInfo) { allMarked = false; } }); }); if (allMarked) { // Draw this.$store.commit(NO_WINNER); this.$store.commit(RESET_GAME); } else { // keep Playing this.$store.commit(CHANGE_TURN); } } // if-else }, // onClickCell }, // methods}</script> Vuex store scripts 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061626364import Vuex from 'vuex';import Vue from 'vue';// Connect vuex to vueVue.use(Vuex); // mutations // es2015, golbalize those mutations exported from a mutations file// then import { ..., Exact_Mutation_Name } export const SET_WINNER = 'SET_WINNER';export const CLICK_CELL = 'CLICK_CELL';export const CHANGE_TURN = 'CHANGE_TURN';export const RESET_GAME = 'RESET_GAME';export const NO_WINNER = 'NO_WINNER';// setting Vuex objectexport default new Vuex.Store({ state: { // similar to vue's data tableSet: [ ['', '', ''], ['', '', ''], ['', '', ''], ], turn: 'O', // use 'O' and 'X' player: 'Player 1', winner: '', draw: false, }, getters: { // similar to vue's computed }, mutations: { // used to change 'state', sychronously // CAPITAL CASE [SET_WINNER](state, winner) { state.winner = winner === 'O' ? 'Player 1' : 'Player 2'; }, [CLICK_CELL](state, { rowInfo, cellInfo }) { // Smae in the Vuex, use `vue.set` for array manipulation Vue.set(state.tableSet[rowInfo], cellInfo, state.turn); state.winner = ''; state.draw = false; }, [CHANGE_TURN](state) { state.turn = state.turn === 'O' ? 'X' : 'O'; state.player = state.turn === 'X' ? 'Player 2' : 'Player 1'; }, [RESET_GAME](state) { state.turn = 'O'; state.tableSet = [ ['', '', ''], ['', '', ''], ['', '', ''], ]; state.player = state.turn === 'X' ? 'Player 2' : 'Player 1'; }, [NO_WINNER](state) { state.winner = ''; state.draw = true; }, }, actions: { // used to change 'state', asychronously or run multiple mutations }, }); Children Components1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162636465666768697071727374757677////////////////////////////////////// Table (child 1) ///////<template> <table> <slot /> </table></template><script>export default { components: { }, props: { }, computed: { // updatung existing value/state tableSet() { // from parent component return this.$store.state.tableSet; }, }, data() { return { } }, methods: { }}</script>/////////////////////////////////// Tr (child 2) ///////<template> <tr> <td-component v-for="(cellData, index) in rowData" :key="index" :cell-index="index" :row-index="rowIndex"> </td-component> </tr></template><script>import tdComponent from './tdComponent';export default { components: { tdComponent, }, props: { rowIndex: Number, }, computed: { rowData() { return this.$store.state.tableSet[this.rowIndex]; }, },}</script>/////////////////////////////////// Td (child 3) ///////<template> <td @click="onClickTd">{{cellData}}</td></template><script>export default { props: { cellData: String, rowIndex: Number, cellIndex: Number, }, computed : { // connects to vuex states with computed ...mapState({ tableSet: state => state.tableSet, turn: state => state.turn, cellData(state) { return state.tableSet[this.rowIndex][this.cellIndex]; }, }), }, methods: { }}</script> Inspired by ZeroCho.
